required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Imsidolimab (ANB019) in the Treatment of Subjects With Acne Vulgaris
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Imsidolimab (ANB019) in the Treatment of Subjects With Acne Vulgaris

brief_summary.textblock: Efficacy and Safety of Imsidolimab in Subjects with Acne Vulgaris

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase 2, multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Imsidolimab in adolescent and adult subjects with acne vulgaris (AV). This study also will characterize the pharmacokinetic (PK) profile of Imsidolimab and explore the immune response to Imsidolimab in subjects with AV.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the effect of Imsidolimab compared with placebo change from baseline in facial inflammatory lesion count at week 12.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in facial inflammatory lesion count at week 12

arm_group.arm_group_label: High Dose Arm: Imsidolimab Biological humanized antibody
Low Dose Arm: Imsidolimab Biological humanized antibody

intervention.arm_group_label: High Dose Arm: Imsidolimab Biological humanized antibody
Low Dose Arm: Imsidolimab Biological humanized antibody

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of moderate to sever facial acne vulgaris
- Facial IGA score of 3 (moderate) or 4 (severe)
- At least 20 and no more than 100 inflammatory lesions on the face
- No more than 100 noninflammatory lesions on the face.
- No more than 5 nodules (â‰¥5 mm) on the face
Exclusion Criteria:
- A subject with acne fulminans or conglobate or secondary acne will be excluded.
